title: After looking at Blitzcrank's kit on his wiki page he just seems . . . weird.
body:
http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Blitzcrank

If I would have never actually seen him in-game and I would only have seen his kit, I would have never guessed that he's a support. His  numbers and weird scalings would make you believe that he either would be an AD bruiser in the jungle or toplane or an AP Assassin.

His Q and ultimate have extremely high AP ratios and base damage, his Q has up to 300 magic damage with a 100% AP ratio and his ult has 500 base damage with another 100% AP ratio. If you look at the kit of your average mage or AP assassin this just seems HUGE even though in reality playing AP Blitzcrank comes close to just trolling.

Then there's something even weirder about him, his W not only gives him movement speed as everyone knows it also gives him . . . ATTACK SPEED? Wut? And his E is not like a Leona Q where it has a base damage plus an AP ratio, it's actually just 100% of your AD as bonus physical damage and it stays at that value, since it doesn't even scale with level, the only thing that really happens is just his cooldown going down with rank. Yet again, if I would never have seen it in game, I would probably play an auto-attack based AD bruiser version of him in the toplane or in the jungle with stuff like Trinity Force, Hydra or maybe even a Manamune build for his passive. And yet again, doing this kind of thing comes really fucking close to trolling when it comes to what it actually is like in-game.

I'm not even complaining - all these weird abilities and mix of ratios and scaling somehow makes him work as a support and not as what Riot probably intended him to be when they created him back in Beta or Alpha or whenever that was. As long as he's not either underpowered or overpowered I'm fine with where he is, it's just so freaking weird when you realize that THIS works.

{{champion:432}} {{champion:412}}

The reason why Blitz is relegated to Support most of the time is because he can't reliably trade with others. 

His attack animation is slow as shit, so his Power Fist can hardly be used as a trading tool. 

His Rocket Grab's mana cost is so high that he can't use it to begin trades on his own often enough to force lane opponent's out. 

He may have great ratios and base damage values, but he has a one-way avenue for expressing those damage values, which really only works in bot lane.
He can't reliably trade due to the nerfs he had when he was shafted to bot lane. He was able to fight guys like Darius and Riven without his Q back when he had his original numbers.
Like Leona he wasn't meant to be a support at first
You say that, yet Riot intentionally made her passive as it is, so the alternative to supporting would be to have a useless passive until ganks/teamfights.

As long as you build a sightstone and a relic shield first it is perfectly fine to go full AP Blitz.

Blitz has always been a strange Champion, but we'd have him no other way.

Full AP Blitzcrank is fine and dandy for early game, but once mid to late game rolls in. You will find it incredibly hard to win games due to how squishy you are and how you have no reliable DPS, and how enemy tanks can bodyblock your hook, unless you are unbelievably fed.

AP tank and full tank are the ways to go.

Most supports have (or use to anyways) have higher scalings to keep them up to par in the matches.


I don't think riot had too much thought into him that early in the game's life... Maybe he will get a rework one day.
He wasn't originally designed to be a support, that's the thing.

The supports now generally have better base damages/shielding, rather than scalings.
That's why healing+shielding amplification is built on supports, rather than AP.

The whole point of a good support is that they do not need as expensive items to function well compared to carries. Thus they usually do not rely on scalings.
Blitzcrank is an exception, because it is an old champion who was originally meant for another role. Luckily his hook and knockup happen to be good support abilities.

Back in the day, Blitzcrank actually truly was a bruiser. In Season 2 and throughout some part of Season 3, he was a very capable jungler, and could also go top lane. Eventually, though, he couldn't compete with fighters that had much more sustained combat capabilities, and ended up shifting to bot lane. In the end, the only reason he survived to this day without some kind of drastic rework is because his tremendous potential burst is counterbalanced by his natural unreliability, amplified even further if you ever decide to go full AP.

I stopped reading right there because he was never intended to be a support. He was intended to be a top lane fighter but ended up going bot because of how extremely poweful his Q was at the time. It originally had lower CD and did more damage because the enemy laners he was intended to fight against could deal with it, but it was a death sentence for botlane champs. This meant it had to be nerfed over and over until it wasn't as deadly to botlane champs.. but this ruined his ability to work anywhere else...

You use to have a lot more build diversity back in the day, so multiple types of scaling were pretty common, even if it was only 1 or 2 abilities (AP yi anyone?)

However, if i recall correctly blitz released as a kind of bruiser, not support. Yet as the meta developed into "feed the ADC kills and let them slaughter everything", a 100% pull was pretty useful for delivering kills to the ADC.

Sadly riot would rather limit the ways players can play champions and release a lot of different champions now, instead of allowing for build diversity and player identity. Every champion is now played in a very specific style, else they're unreasonably weaker. A few champions have slipped past riot's design team, but often out of lack of concern for their impact. Attrox's E & R scaling, Blitz, yorick and malz until recently, just to name a few.
